ygData.subject: Re: Singing Strategy
ygData.msgSnippet: Uhm - the point of the thread was how to spread damage more equally among the group -- so instead of telling the war/ranger/wiz how to play his class
ygData.messageBody:
Uhm - the point of the thread was "how to spread damage more equally among
the group" -- so instead of "telling" the war/ranger/wiz "how to play his
class" (even the most tactful suggestions may not be well received) why not
try asking him to think up a solution to the group's problem? Ie: if he's
such a good ranger/war/wiz, let him think up the way to spread the damage
around.

Sylly

p.s. "Stop chaining damn it! I am darknessing!" "Duh, forgot, sorry"

----- Original Message -----
From: Ken Bachman <kbachman@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, January 26, 2000 9:26 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Singing Strategy


> From: Ken Bachman <kbachman@...>
>
> > ... Would anyone seriously ever suggest a
> > ranger only dual-wield for part of a fight? Or that a warrior not use
his
> > extra attacks for part of a fight? ...
> > Kitasi
>
> I wouldn't suggest those two things, no, but that misses the point a bit.
When
> I play my warrior, I will often stop taunting and will sometimes stop
swinging
> altogether in order to balance out the damage, and to keep the MOBs
spinning.
> It's much easier for a party to copy with balanced damage, and a spinning
MOB
> attacks less, so both are useful.
>
> Kenross Cantoforjado, 40 songs, Innoruuk
